intro: Adenostylis philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine adenostylis, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Adenostylis philippinensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and small fauna.
